    • Uses of PlantComponent in pcomponents

      Subclasses of PlantComponent in pcomponents 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Condenser
      Condenser class is a plant component that takes steam as an input and converts some of the steam inside it to water.
      class  ConnectorPipe
      ConnectorPipe class only really extends PlantComponent for consistency in the model.
      class  Generator
      Generator class is used to calculate the power output of the plant based on the current RPM of the Turbine.
      class  Pump
      Pump is a plant component that pumps some amount of water based on pump's "on" state and its RPM.
      class  Reactor
      A reactor is an object that controls the nuclear reaction inside the plant.
      class  Turbine
      The turbine is a class that makes the generator create power output.
      class  Valve
      Valve is a component that doesn't randomly fail (currently).

      Methods in simulator with parameters of type PlantComponent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void UIData.addBrokenOnStep(PlantComponent broken)
      Adds a broken component to list brokenOnStep.
      private void PlantController.blockToPrecedingConnectorPipe(PlantComponent blockedComponent)
      Traces back to the first occurring connector pipe and blocks the path out leading to blockedComponent.
      private boolean PlantController.isPathTo(PlantComponent start, PlantComponent goal, boolean forwards)
      Returns true if there exists a path from start to goal that is not blocked and does not pass through a pressurised component (Reactor/Condenser) in the direction that is specified.
      private void PlantController.propagateFlowToNextConnectorPipe(PlantComponent startComponent)
      Propagates the flow rate and temperature to every component from startComponent until a ConnectorPipe is encountered.
      private void ReactorUtils.setupInputOutputReferences(PlantComponent from, PlantComponent to)
      Takes two PlantComponents and creates the input/output references between them.
